summary: This is my first digital camera and while I was camera searching there are two very important things that you have to take into consideration.
I would either purchase a set of rechargable batteries or try another camera.The pictures that we have taken do turn out very well.
Try experimenting with the features to find something that suits you.For the money, its a great camera, but dont expect miracles out of it.
Although it is a bargain and not a bad camera, I found it too frustrating for regular use.
In short, buy an Olympus, this camera was intended to replace the same and except for it's ability to shoot movies, it doesn't.
It has a quirk in that if you don't have the machine on before booting up, it will only appear as a CD recorder.
But so far, I've been unable to burn a DVD in any of the packaged Nero applications, not as backup, not as a data disc.
My guess is that this would take a lot less time on a faster system.
This burner took me a little getting used to, but now that I am, it works just great, with minimal sound when compared to other burners.
I haven't used the double layer feature yet, but I am quite pleased with the speed and accuracy of this burner.
I even lowered the master volume on my Pioneer AV system since the sound coming out of this speaker is so much better than my speaker in a box.
This is so well matched with my CV tower speakers that you can't pinpoint the source of the sound when watching movies in digital format.
It has really enhanced my sound system for the money I paid for it, It is a great little speaker for it's price.
I am using two ve-12's as my fronts and wanted a center to be voice matched.
The sound is so clear and crisp, don't have to have the sound turned up so loud now to hear the voices.
